poem:
Title: A Fall From Grace

Party fortress cracks, the strong now weak,
Britannia's blue cowl grows bleak.
A canvas scoured of Tory hue,
Replaced by Labour's striking view.
From rural creeks to urban sprawl,
No precinct stands, but all do fall.
Now, shines less bright the Tory star,
A Spartan prime minister, stands afar.
Each decayed seat, a testament to battle,
Echoes the drum, of an approaching death rattle.
